trans-unit.source: Azure Batch Linked Service
trans-unit.target: Azure Batch Linked Service

trans-unit.source: Azure Batch Linked Service
trans-unit.target: Azure Batch Linked Service

trans-unit.source: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides the JSON format that is supported by the July 2015 Release of Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="6c2eeefb-f1f7-4de2-8dfd-0369a83d23d7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Batch Linked Service</link> for the old JSON format.
trans-unit.target: If you are using an older version, see <link xlink:href="6c2eeefb-f1f7-4de2-8dfd-0369a83d23d7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Batch Linked Service</link> for the old JSON format.

trans-unit.source: You create an Azure Batch linked service to link an Azure Batch pool of virtual machines (VMs) to an Azure data factory.
trans-unit.target: You create an Azure Batch linked service to link an Azure Batch pool of virtual machines (VMs) to an Azure data factory.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the JSON properties for defining an Azure Batch linked service.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the JSON properties for defining an Azure Batch linked service.

trans-unit.source: When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.
trans-unit.target: When you use the Data Factory Editor in Azure Portal, the editor provides you a JSON template for defining a linked service that you can modify and deploy to create a linked service.

trans-unit.source: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: To use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.Azure.Commands.DataFactories.New-AzureDataFactoryLinkedService</codeEntityReference> cmdlet to create a linked service, you will need to create a JSON file and use it with the cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: You can run .NET custom activities using either Azure Batch or Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: You can run .NET custom activities using either Azure Batch or Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: To use Azure Batch to run the custom activity:
trans-unit.target: To use Azure Batch to run the custom activity:

trans-unit.source: Create a linked service of type <embeddedLabel>AzureBatch</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Create a linked service of type <embeddedLabel>AzureBatch</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Associate this linked service with the custom activity.
trans-unit.target: Associate this linked service with the custom activity.

trans-unit.source: You do this by specifying the linked service as the value for the <embeddedLabel>linkedServiceName</embeddedLabel> property in the activity definition of pipeline JSON.
trans-unit.target: You do this by specifying the linked service as the value for the <embeddedLabel>linkedServiceName</embeddedLabel> property in the activity definition of pipeline JSON.

trans-unit.source: See following topics if you are new to Azure Batch service:
trans-unit.target: See following topics if you are new to Azure Batch service:

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Azure Batch Technical Overview</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-technical-overview/</linkUri></externalLink> for an overview of the Azure Batch service.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Azure Batch Technical Overview</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-technical-overview/</linkUri></externalLink> for an overview of the Azure Batch service.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureBatchAccount</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt125880.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to create an Azure Batch account (or) <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/batch-technical-overview/#batch-concepts</linkUri></externalLink> to create the Azure Batch account using Azure Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureBatchAccount</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt125880.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to create an Azure Batch account (or) <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/batch-technical-overview/#batch-concepts</linkUri></externalLink> to create the Azure Batch account using Azure Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Using PowerShell to manage Azure Batch Account</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/windowshpc/archive/2014/10/28/using-azure-powershell-to-manage-azure-batch-account.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> topic for detailed instructions on using the cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Using PowerShell to manage Azure Batch Account</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.technet.com/b/windowshpc/archive/2014/10/28/using-azure-powershell-to-manage-azure-batch-account.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> topic for detailed instructions on using the cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureBatchPool</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt125936.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to create an Azure Batch pool.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>New-AzureBatchPool</linkText><linkUri>https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/mt125936.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> cmdlet to create an Azure Batch pool.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Use custom activities in an Azure Data Factory pipeline</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/data-factory-use-custom-activities/</linkUri></externalLink> article for more details.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Use custom activities in an Azure Data Factory pipeline</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/data-factory-use-custom-activities/</linkUri></externalLink> article for more details.

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: type
trans-unit.target: type

trans-unit.source: The type property should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureBatch</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The type property should be set to <embeddedLabel>AzureBatch</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: accountName
trans-unit.target: accountName

trans-unit.source: Name of the Azure Batch account.
trans-unit.target: Name of the Azure Batch account.

trans-unit.source: accessKey
trans-unit.target: accessKey

trans-unit.source: Access key for the Azure Batch account.
trans-unit.target: Access key for the Azure Batch account.

trans-unit.source: poolName
trans-unit.target: poolName

trans-unit.source: Name of the pool of virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Name of the pool of virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: linkedServiceName
trans-unit.target: linkedServiceName

trans-unit.source: Name of the Azure Storage linked service associated with this Azure Batch linked service.
trans-unit.target: Name of the Azure Storage linked service associated with this Azure Batch linked service.

trans-unit.source: This linked service is used for staging files required to run the activity and storing the activity execution logs.
trans-unit.target: This linked service is used for staging files required to run the activity and storing the activity execution logs.

trans-unit.source: Azure Data Factory Updates: Execute ADF Custom .NET activities using Azure Batch
trans-unit.target: Azure Data Factory Updates: Execute ADF Custom .NET activities using Azure Batch
